title: Criticism of Capitalism and Globalization - Collection 17
description:
Criticism of Capitalism and Globalization - Collection 17:

We have 35 titles here:

-  Anievas & Nisancioglu - How the West Came to Rule; the Geopolitical Origins of Capitalism (2015)

-  Barak (Ed.) - The Routledge International Handbook of the Crimes of the Powerful (2015)

-  Beausang - Globalization and the BRICs; Why the BRICs Will Not Rule the World for Long (2012)

-  Bircham & Charlton (Eds.) - Anti-Capitalism; a Guide to the Movement (2001)

-  Bourguignon - The Globalization of Inequality (2015)

-  Bridge - Midnight in the American Empire; How Corporations and Their Political Servants Are Destroying the American Dream (2012)

-  Cobben - Value in Capitalist Society; Rethinking Marx's Criticism of Capitalism (2015)

-  Collins - 99 to 1; How Wealth Inequality Is Wrecking the World and What We Can Do about It (2012)

-  Davis - If You Came This Way; a Journey Through the Lives of the Underclass (1995)

-  Dorre et al - Sociology, Capitalism, Critique (2009, 2015)

-  Ebenau et al (Eds.) - New Directions in Comparative Capitalisms Research; Critical and Global Perspectives (2015)

-  Feldner & Vighi - Critical Theory and the Crisis of Contemporary Capitalism (2015)

-  Fisher & Downey (Eds.) - Frontiers of Capital; Ethnographic Reflections on the New Economy (2006)

-  Fleming - The Mythology of Work; How Capitalism Persists Despite Itself (2015)

-  Katz - The Influence Machine; the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and the Corporate Capture of American Life (2015)

-  Kendall - Morality and Capitalism; a Dialogue on Freedom (2014)

-  Koepsell - Who Owns You; Science, Innovation, and the Gene Patent Wars, 2e (2015)

-  Kotler - Confronting Capitalism; Real Solutions for a Troubled Economic System (2015)

-  Lichtenstein - A Contest of Ideas; Capital, Politics, and Labor (2013)

-  Manda - The God Market; How Globalization Is Making India More Hindu (2009)

-  Marrs - Population Control; How Corporate Owners Are Killing Us (2015)

-  McChesney - Digital Disconnect; How Capitalism Is Turning the Internet Against Democracy (2013)

-  Meillasoux - Maidens, Meal and Money; Capitalism and the Domestic Community (1981)

-  Pirson et al (Eds.) - From Capitalistic to Humanistic Business (2014)

-  Porter - The Global Village Myth; Distance, War, and the Limits of Power (2015)

-  Ritzer (Ed.) - The Wiley-Blackwell Encyclopedia of Globalization (2012)

-  Rodrik - Has Globalization Gone Too Far (1994)

-  Sanyal - Rethinking Capitalist Development; Primitive Accumulation, Governmentality and Post-colonial Capitalism (2007)

-  Schermerhorn - The Business of Slavery and the Rise of American Capitalism, 1815-1860 (2015)

-  Swader - The Capitalist Personality; Face-to-Face Sociality and Economic Change in the Post-Communist World (2013)

-  Vetlesen - The Denial of Nature; Environmental Philosophy in the Era of Global Capitalism (2015)

-  Wallerstein - Capitalist Agriculture and the Origins of the European World-Economy in the Sixteenth Century (2011)

-  Walraven - Health and Poverty; Global Health Problems and Solutions (2011)

-  Walter & Howie - Red Capitalism; the Fragile Financial Foundation of China's Extraordinary Rise (2012)

-  Wysong et al - The New Class Society; Goodbye American Dream, 4e (2014)
